directions.dialogText: Let's program our first button! Write \`getAcorn();\` between the \`{  }\`s in the \`getAcornButton()\` function and run your code to set Button 1. Then press the button!

levels.mission: Write \`getAcorn();\` between the \`{  }\`s in the \`getAcornButton()\` function and run your code to set Button 1. Then use the button to get the acorn.
levels.tools:
\`right()\`- face right

\`left()\`- face left

\`up()\`- face up

\`down()\`- face down

\`move(number)\`- move forward that number of squares

\`getAcorn()\`- pick up acorn

\`setButton(number, function)\`- set button by number

directions.dialogText: Good job! Now let's make a MOVE button. We've written most of the code for you. Just add \`move();\` between the \`{ }\`s in the \`moveButton()\` function. Then run your code and use your buttons!

levels.mission: Write \`move();\` between the \`{  }\`s in the \`moveButton()\` function and run your code to the buttons. Then use the buttons to get the acorn.
levels.tools:
\`right()\`- face right

\`left()\`- face left

\`up()\`- face up

\`down()\`- face down

\`move(number)\`- move forward that number of squares

\`getAcorn()\`- pick up acorn

\`setButton(number, function)\`- set button by number

directions.dialogText: OK! This time you will have to write a little more code. To set button 3, you need to create a function called \`leftButton()\` which turns the squirrel \`left()\`. We've started you off with \`function \`. You finish it!

levels.mission: After \`function\` write \`leftButton(){}\`. Then BETWEEN the \`{ }\`s, write \`left();\` on a new line. When you are done, run the code and use the buttons to pass the level.
levels.tools:
\`right()\`- face right

\`left()\`- face left

\`up()\`- face up

\`down()\`- face down

\`move(number)\`- move forward that number of squares

\`getAcorn()\`- pick up acorn

\`setButton(number, function)\`- set button by number

directions.dialogText: You are ready to create a function all by yourself. To set button 4, you need to create a function called \`rightButton()\` which turns the squirrel \`right()\`. Add it below the code that's already there.

levels.mission: On line 18, write \`function rightButton(){}\`. Then BETWEEN the \`{ }\`s, write \`right();\` on a new line. When you are done, run the code and use the buttons to pass the level.
levels.tools:
\`right()\`- face right

\`left()\`- face left

\`up()\`- face up

\`down()\`- face down

\`move(number)\`- move forward that number of squares

\`getAcorn()\`- pick up acorn

\`setButton(number, function)\`- set button by number

quiz.text: Which choice would give the variable \`number\` a value of \`10\`?

directions.dialogText: Well, you probably know the drill by now! Create a \`function\` called \`upButton()\` that makes the squirrel face up.

levels.mission: On line 23, write \`function upButton(){}\`. Then BETWEEN the \`{ }\`s, write \`up();\` on a new line. When you are done, run the code and use the buttons to pass the level.
levels.tools:
\`right()\`- face right

\`left()\`- face left

\`up()\`- face up

\`down()\`- face down

\`move(number)\`- move forward that number of squares

\`getAcorn()\`- pick up acorn

\`setButton(number, function)\`- set button by number

directions.dialogText: OK! Last button! Create a function called \`downButton()\` that makes the squirrel face \`down()\`. Then run it and use those buttons!

levels.mission: On line 28, write \`function downButton(){}\`. Then BETWEEN the \`{ }\`s, write \`down();\` on a new line. When you are done, run the code and use the buttons to pass the level.
levels.tools:
\`right()\`- face right

\`left()\`- face left

\`up()\`- face up

\`down()\`- face down

\`move(number)\`- move forward that number of squares

\`getAcorn()\`- pick up acorn

\`setButton(number, function)\`- set button by number

directions.dialogText: Good work! No new code to write on this level. Just play around!

levels.mission: Get the acorns or just run around! And don't forget to turn up the speed.
levels.tools:
\`right()\`- face right

\`left()\`- face left

\`up()\`- face up

\`down()\`- face down

\`move(number)\`- move forward that number of squares

\`getAcorn()\`- pick up acorn

\`setButton(number, function)\`- set button by number
levels.tips: Don't bet on a slow horse. That's the only tip on this level.
